content:
##What are $\redC{\text{lines}}$ and $\purpleD{\text{line segments}}$ and $\blueD{\text{rays}}$?

A $\redC{\text{line}}$ extends forever in both directions, like this:   

[[☃ image 1]]

A $\purpleD{\text{line segment}}$ is just part of a line. It has two endpoints, like this:   

[[☃ image 2]]

A $\blueD{\text{ray}}$ starts at one point and continues on forever in one direction, like this:  

[[☃ image 3]]

*Want to learn more about lines, line segments, and rays?  Check out [this video](/v/lines-line-segments-and-rays).*

options.alt: A line with arrows on each end pointing outward in opposite directions.
A line with dots on each end.
A dot with an arrow extending from it.

content:
##Practice set 1: Identify lines, line segments, and rays

[[☃ graded-group-set 2]]

*Want to try more problems like this? Check out [this exercise](/e/recognizing_rays_lines_and_line_segments).*

gradedGroups.content:
**Which of the following figures show a dashed $\greenD{\text{ray}}$?**  
Consider the *entire* dashed structure in each figure. 

[[☃ radio 1]]

hint.content:
A *ray* starts at one point and goes on forever in one direction, like this:  

[[☃ image 1]]

Figure $C$ shows a dashed $\greenD{\text{ray}}$.

options.alt: A dot with an arrow extending from it.

gradedGroups.title: Problem 1A

choices.content: Figure $A$: ![A straight dashed green mark connects two sides of a figure, extending beyond the figure on both ends. Each end of the mark has an arrow. There is a green dot at each of the connection points.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/0f100d4ff41c462df57b6ecea7227f3a32cf887d)

Figure $B$:  ![A straight dashed green mark connects two sides of a figure. There is a green dot at each of the connection points.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ec1392b598eca1a2296ea52f2677a30937c037ea)

Figure $C$: ![A straight dashed green mark connects two sides of a figure, extending beyond the figure on one end. That end of the mark has an arrow. There is a green dot at both of the connection points.](web+graphie://ka-perseus-graphie.s3.amazonaws.com/ef8d75434d964f00126e1bf17474a631ba1ae68c)

gradedGroups.content:
**What is the dashed part of the figure below?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

[[☃ image 1]]

hint.content:
The dashed part of the diagram is part of a line that starts at one point and ends at another point, like this:  

[[☃ image 1]]

A straight, geometric figure that starts at one point and ends at another point is called a *line segment*.

The dashed figure is a line segment.

options.alt: A straight mark with dots on each end.

gradedGroups.title: Problem 1B

options.alt: A straight dashed green mark connects two sides of a figure. There is a green dot at each of the connection points.

gradedGroups.content:
**Which of the following lines appear in the diagram below?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

[[☃ image 1]]

hint.content:
A *line* extends forever in both directions.  

For example, $\overleftrightarrow{XY}$ names a line that passes through point $X$ and point $Y$, extending forever in either direction:

[[☃ image 1]]

Let's look at figures in the diagram and see if they are lines.

$\greenD{\overleftrightarrow{DE}}$ passes through point $\greenD{D}$ and point $\greenD{E}$, extending forever in both directions.  So, it is a line.

[[☃ image 2]]

Line $\greenD{\overleftrightarrow{DE}}$ is in the diagram.

options.alt: A straight horizontal mark passing through dots X and Y with arrows on both ends.

A rectangle with dots at its 4 corners labeled moving clockwise A, D, E, and B. Side AD of the rectangle is an arrow starting at A and extends beyond D. Side DE of the rectangle is a straight dashed green mark that extends beyond both dots and has arrows on each end. A triangle inside the rectangle shares one side BE with the rectangle. The 3 corners of the triangle are labeled B, C, and E.

gradedGroups.title: Problem 1C

options.alt: A rectangle with dots at its 4 corners labeled moving clockwise A, D, E, and B. Side AD of the rectangle is an arrow starting at A and extends beyond D. Side DE of the rectangle is a straight mark that extends beyond both dots and has arrows on each end. A triangle inside the rectangle shares one side BE with the rectangle. The 3 corners of the triangle are labeled B, C, and E.

choices.content: $\overleftrightarrow{BC}$, the line passing through points $B$ and $C$
$\overleftrightarrow{DE}$, the line passing through points $D$ and $E$
$\overleftrightarrow{BD}$, the line passing through points $B$ and $D$

content:
##Practice set 2: Draw lines, line segments, and rays

[[☃ graded-group-set 3]]

*Want to try more problems like this? Check out [this exercise](/e/drawing-lines).*

gradedGroups.content:
**Drag the lines so one line goes through points $\text{A}$ and $\text{D}$, and the other line goes through points $\text{B}$  and $\text{C}$.**  
[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

These are lines because they each have [[☃ dropdown 1]] and continue forever in [[☃ dropdown 2]].

hint.content:
Here's what it looks like after making one line go though points $\text{A}$ and $\text{D}$.  

[[☃ image 1]]

Here's what the final product looks like.  

[[☃ image 2]]

These are lines because they each have **zero endpoints**, and they continue forever in **two directions**.

options.alt: A straight green mark with arrows on both ends connects dot A at the upper left corner with dot D at the bottom right corner. Point B is at the upper right corner and point C is at the bottom left corner.

A straight green mark with arrows on both ends connects dot A at the upper left corner with dot D at the bottom right corner. A straight orange mark with arrows on both ends connects dot C at the bottom left corner with dot B at the upper right corner. These marks intersect each other at their center points.

gradedGroups.title: Problem 2A

gradedGroups.content:
**Move the ray so it has an endpoint at point $\text{A}$ and goes through point $\text{B}$. Then complete the statement below.**

[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

This is a ray because it has [[☃ dropdown 1]], and it continues forever in [[☃ dropdown 2]].

hint.content:
After dragging the points, the picture should look like this:

[[☃ image 1]]

This is a ray because it has **one endpoint**, and it continues forever in **one direction**.

options.alt: A straight mark starts at dot A and extends left and upward, passing through dot B, with an arrow on its top left end.

gradedGroups.title: Problem 2B

gradedGroups.content:
**Use the line segments to connect all possible pairs of the points $\text{A}$, $\text{B}$, and $\text{C}$. Then complete the statement below. **
[[☃ interactive-graph 1]]

These are line segments because they each have [[☃ dropdown 1]] and continue forever in [[☃ dropdown 2]].

hint.content:
Here's what it looks like after connecting points $\text{A}$ and $\text{B}$.  

[[☃ image 1]]

Try connecting the other pairs of points.

Here's what it looks like after connecting all the pairs of points.

[[☃ image 2]]

These are line segments because they each have **two endpoints**, and they continue forever in **zero directions**.

options.alt: A straight mark connects dot A on its bottom left to dot B at its top right. Dot C lies at some distance below and slightly to the left of dot B.

A figure with 3 sides and 3 corners A, B, C. A long straight mark extends to the right and slightly upward from dot A and connects it to dot B. A long straight mark extends down and slightly to the left from dot B and connects it to dot C. A long straight mark extends upward and to the right and connects dot C to dot A.

gradedGroups.title: Problem 2C
